content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research. A recent attempt to supply power near the lab (via an extra small electric pole at x=-5.5, y=18.5) failed due to spacing conflict; the lab was instead connected through the existing electricity network—linking it to the electric pole at (x=3.5, y=19.5)—although the lab still remains in a NO_POWER state.
• Electricity Group comprising:
 – Existing small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5);
 – Additional poles at (x=-7.5, y=16.5) and (x=-8.5, y=13.5);
 – Merged network poles at (x=-17.5, y=13.5) and (x=-17.5, y=16.5).
• Steam Engines:
 – Primary steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) [NOT_CONNECTED]
 – Additional engines at (x=-14.5, y=13.5), (x=7.5, y=35.5) and (x=8.5, y=20.5)
• Fluid System Submodule – Boiler Module:
 – Pre-existing Boiler at (x=-13.5, y=19.0) [NOT_CONNECTED]
 – Intermediate pipe at (x=-17.5, y=21.5) (connection attempt failed)
 – New Boiler and Steam Engine Pair:
  ∙ New Boiler originally placed at (x=-14.0, y=16.5) and repositioned to (x=-10.0, y=22.5) [NOT_CONNECTED – fluid connection unresolved]
  ∙ New Steam Engine at (x=-7.5, y=11.5) [NOT_CONNECTED]
 – Fluid and water connections for the new pair remain unresolved.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for Iron Gear Wheel production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5).
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain comprising horizontal segments (e.g. at x=7.5 and x=8.5 along y=15.5) and vertical segments from y=14.5 down to y=11.5 (with noted blockages).
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem with burner inserters at various positions.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) operating (WORKING).
• Boiler for fluid heating at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).
• Pipe Connection established via a PipeGroup starting at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) and extending to (x=-30.5, y=34.5).
• New segmented pipe connection attempt to link the Offshore Pump with the New Boiler at (x=-10.0, y=22.5) using computed candidate positions:
 – Candidate 1 at (x=-25.157818046049, y=34.456940033695): segment from the pump to this candidate failed.
 – Candidate 2 at (x=-21.315636092099, y=29.913880067389): segment connecting Candidate 1 to Candidate 2 succeeded, but the subsequent segment from Candidate 2 to the boiler failed.
• Overall, the fluid connection between the Offshore Pump and the New Boiler remains unresolved.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Segmented Pipe Connection Issues:
 – When establishing segmented pipe links, verify that candidate positions are accurately computed, buildable, and unobstructed. Ensure that connection points on both the source (e.g. Offshore Pump) and target (e.g. New Boiler) are within allowed proximity and have compatible fluid input/output requirements.
 – In cases where a segment (such as from the pump to Candidate 1 or from Candidate 2 to the boiler) fails, recheck both the buildability of the target tile and the fluid demands of the receiving entity.

• Crafting and Research Prerequisites:
 – Confirm that all necessary technology prerequisites are unlocked prior to attempting to craft advanced items (for example, storage tanks require Fluid‑Handling technology, which in turn mandates completion of Automation‑2 and Electronics research).
 – Validate that the target tile for entity placement—especially for game-critical items such as storage tanks—has no obstructions and is buildable to avoid “can_place_entity returned False” errors.

• Research Progress Delays and Prerequisite Failures:
 – Ensure prerequisite research (e.g. Electronics for Automation‑2) is completed before setting new technology goals; missing prerequisites lead to research timeouts.
 – Monitor research progress and adjust science pack supply as needed, since insufficient ingredients or prolonged iterations can hinder research completion.

• Crafting Sub-ingredient Availability:
 – When crafting complex items like automation science packs, verify that all required sub-ingredients (for instance, copper-plate) are craftable with available machines (e.g. furnaces or assembling machines). This prevents errors due to missing components.

• Electric Pole Placement Conflicts:
 – Before attempting to place an electric pole (such as to power the Lab), confirm that the target placement tile is not already occupied by another entity. Adjust spacing, direction, or reference positions as needed to meet placement constraints.

• Movement & Positioning Constraints (from previous reports):
 – Always update the player’s location accurately prior to placement actions. Distance errors can occur if the agent remains erroneously at (0,0) or another default location.
 – If an initial placement fails due to distance constraints, ensure proper relocation and allow time for game state updates before reattempting.

• Boiler Placement and Buildability (from previous reports):
 – Pre-check that the placement area for boilers is free of obstructions, water overlaps, or invalid surfaces to avoid repeated “can_place_entity returned False” errors.

• Fluid and Pipe Connection Inventory (from previous reports):
 – Before segmented pipe connections, verify that sufficient pipe inventory is on hand. Inventory errors citing insufficient pipes indicate the need to stock additional resources.
 – Validate that each computed candidate for pipe placement is unobstructed and meets all fluid connection requirements.

• Entity Retrieval and Repositioning (from previous reports):
 – After picking up an entity for repositioning, ensure it is completely removed from the map prior to re-placement to prevent cascading errors.
 – Confirm successful reinsertion in a clear and accessible tile to maintain proper system connectivity.
